column4: i see a cron job for slocate in cron.daily but it's not being run. anyone know why?
`slocate test' : slocate: fatal error: Could not find user database '/var/lib/slocate/slocate.db'
it should be run by anacron, when you boot or at 7:30 am
do you have an anacron crontab fragment in /etc/cron.d ?
should i see crond in ps ax | grep crond?
and to answer the question, yes you should see cron running
Jul  5 22:55:22 mist anacron[7183]: Anacron 2.3 started on 2008-07-05       \n            Jul  5 22:55:22 mist anacron[7183]: Normal exit (0 jobs run

strange, I get: Jul  5 19:57:02 aias anacron[19129]: Anacron 2.3 started on 2008-07-05 /n Jul  5 19:57:02 aias anacron[19129]: Will run job `cron.daily' in 5 min. /n Jul  5 19:57:02 aias anacron[19129]: Jobs will be executed sequentially
that is strange. i'll ask our sysadmin to take a look at the system, thanks.
take a look at /etc/anacrontab, what do you have there?
same as mine. It's been a while since I tracked anacron & cron, I'm not sure why it would be ignoring that tab
I'll sleep on it, maybe it will come to me. thanks for showing me the places to look
